title: DIN-like sans serif
content:
Please help me to identify the sans serif used in the menue. Is the heading the same typeface by the way?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Bilde 3.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173318/http:/typophile.com/files/Bilde%203.png) | 56.75 KB |

 [‹ Severn Trent logo font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173318/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44623 "Go to previous forum topic") [Jekyll & Hyde ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173318/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44601 "Go to next forum topic")
author: John Erik

comments.content:
no, at most it could be a modified version of hermes.  
the hermes Ø-slash strikes through the Ø. in your sample it does not.
